intro: Pasania microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces tiny, dry fruits that contain minute seeds. Pasania microsperma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
